product_requests.description: An AI-powered tool that critiques and challenges project ideas, startup plans, or pitch decks to uncover hidden threats and flaws. It performs deep reviews, integrates with multiple data providers, and generates comprehensive due diligence reports.
product_requests.pain_point: Startup founders and investors struggle to get unbiased, constructive criticism on their projects, often only receiving positive feedback, leading to overlooked flaws and potential failures. Manual due diligence is time-consuming and expensive.
product_requests.target_audience: Startup Founders, VCs, Angel Investors, Product Managers

tweets.text:
I‚Äôve built a tool that will critique and challenge your project to help you uncover hidden threats. Made for investors, VCs and startup founders.

From my experience, it‚Äôs very hard to get constructive criticism when you‚Äôre deep in a project. It‚Äôs much easier to hear that what you‚Äôre doing is great and that you should follow your dreams, plans, and ideas. That‚Äôs one of the main reasons some of my own projects failed. They had a lot of flaws and issues but no one told me about them, all I heard was a positive feedback.

To address this, I built a tool that acts as a ‚Äúrisk analyst‚Äù and does a deep review of projects. I spent a month on it, and the first version is ready. It uses top AI models like Gemini 2.5 Pro, o3, Grok-4, and Claude 4. It‚Äôs integrated with 10 data providers. In a single analysis, it visits around 2,000 pages, consumes ~100M input tokens, and generates ~5M output tokens. It‚Äôs already huge‚Äîand it‚Äôs just the first version.

I‚Äôm currently testing it in practice before releasing it to everyone. It‚Äôs a great tool for investors, VCs, and startup founders, you can get a comprehensive due diligence report within a few hours. All it needs as input is a pitch deck.

If you‚Äôre a startup founder or investor and would like a free analysis of a project, just send me a message. In return, I ask for detailed, constructive feedback üòÑ. In the future, reports will cost around $100‚Äì$200 USD (TBD).
I‚Äôm attaching a report from my previous startup idea. It takes about 4 hours to produce a report like this for your project ‚Äî just send me a pitch deck or post it in the comment üòâ

Here's the report - https://t.co/nbuE6OPfRo

product_requests.description: A platform or tool that unifies various developer tools, resources, and documentation in one place, reducing 'tab hell' and making it easier to find and manage relevant information and tools. It should also help in discovering existing tools for specific problems.
product_requests.pain_point: Developers face a 'paradox of choice' with too many similar tools, difficulty in finding the right tool for a specific problem, and managing scattered resources (links, sheets, guides) across multiple tabs and applications.
product_requests.target_audience: Software Developers, Engineers, Indie Hackers, Development Teams

tweets.text:
TIL no. 49: paradox of choice

there are way way way to many dev tools doing extremely similar things, advocating for minor differences, and desiring lock-in. 

building @withduckyAI has gone from a simple proof of concept that i thought i could whip up in a weekend to a headache in deciding what to build it with. 

now, its still a pretty simple idea and the architecture behind is relatively simple but that‚Äôs not what i learned, it‚Äôs that there are so many tools that implement these architectural patterns that make it difficult to truly pick one and build with it. 

i‚Äôm well aware of migrations and switching tools but that‚Äôs so much of a hassle. i just want one tool that does everything i want lol. i want personalized production grade software.

all the tools in one place is wild

this literally solves the endless tab hell
ctrl+f‚Äôing for random links Ô∏è gone
missed sheets, half-finished guides Ô∏è gone
can actually just bookmark and touch grass now lmao

fantasytop on blast, monad testnet, full builder credits, full guide, full sauce   all visible, no scavenger hunt

hub energy   curated fan brains + founders + platform + tools you didn‚Äôt know you needed

who‚Äôs adding the next fan scan? appreciate the open door, phan

phantom lost tools, found

link stays in the quickbar forever

Every time I run into something challenging in AWS that I brute force my way through I have an idea to build a tool, and then I found the tool already exists in one way or another but I wouldn't have known to search for it until I was three quarters of the way through.
open source tool for unified search across all your data and apps https://t.co/hdA5eY9pWo

ni yo uso ideascraper!!  üòî

ayer estaba buscando en google: site:reddit. com "is there a tool for" + [nicho], abro el post , vuelvo a la busqueda.

eso es lo que tiene que hacer üß© ideascraper.
debeser un buscador de oportunidades...que ademas genera ideas https://t.co/UpG2Rh85bO

product_requests.description: A mobile application that allows users to take a picture of a DIY project (e.g., a hole in the wall, a bathroom vanity) and then guides them through the necessary steps, suggests in-stock items from local supply stores (with prices), and helps build a shopping cart for pickup or delivery. It should also allow for design modifications (colors, items).
product_requests.pain_point: DIY enthusiasts and contractors struggle with planning projects, identifying necessary materials, checking stock across multiple stores, and visualizing the end result. The process is intimidating for beginners and time-consuming for experienced individuals.
product_requests.target_audience: DIY Homeowners, Small Contractors, Interior Designers

tweets.text:
@HomeDepot Needs to vibecode an app the can take a picture of any potential DIY project like a hole in the wall or a bathroom vanity, or piece of furniture, then that app walks the customer through the store items/options they can choose that are in stock at the store location, select from lists provided & build a cart and just go pick up orders like Walmart‚Ä¶. 

DIY people could plan projects in advance, and contractors have an easy way to schedule small jobs in advance‚Ä¶ 

Devs‚Ä¶. Build it to include EVERY supply stores inventory into the selections with prices listed and sell it to GC‚Äôs! 

This will also inspire Creativity & Improvement and the ability to plan future projects for people who might be intimidated but curious about their ideas. 

BONUS: Display the items selected by the user so they can make changes to items and colors if necessary. 

Get on it. You‚Äôre welcome! ü§úü§õüèº

product_requests.description: An application that analyzes large datasets of viral social media posts (e.g., Reddit, X) to identify underlying structural patterns (e.g., opening hooks, tension building, truth bombs). Users can then use these blueprints to remix and create their own content, tailored to their niche and voice.
product_requests.pain_point: Content creators struggle to achieve virality, often feeling like they are 'screaming into the void' with low engagement. They lack a systematic approach to understanding and replicating successful content structures.
product_requests.target_audience: Content Creators, Social Media Managers, Marketers, Influencers

tweets.text:
I discovered a strange pattern hidden in 10,000 viral Reddit posts.

Not by choice.
I was stuck.

No followers. No engagement.
Just me, screaming into the void.

So I stopped writing... and started studying.

I downloaded every viral post I could find..

Late nights, blurry eyes, 10k+ posts.

And weirdly‚Ä¶
They all felt different.
But the structure? Almost identical.

They all opened with a gut punch.

They built tension, like a thriller.

And they ended with a twist or a truth bomb.

It wasn‚Äôt art. It was a blueprint.

So I built an app.

One that finds these viral patterns.
From every niche. Every category.

And lets you remix them
For your story. Your voice. Your content.

Because virality isn‚Äôt magic.
It‚Äôs repeatable if you know where to look.

product_requests.description: A robust search and filtering functionality for large gaming platforms (like Fortnite) that allows users to easily find specific official game modes or curated content, bypassing irrelevant or low-quality user-generated maps.
product_requests.pain_point: Gamers are frustrated by the inability to quickly find desired official game modes amidst an overwhelming amount of user-generated content, leading to wasted time and annoyance.
product_requests.target_audience: Gamers, especially those on platforms with extensive user-generated content

tweets.text: Genuine question why the fuck is there no search functionality for Fortnite modes.  I fucking hate looking for a specific OFFICIAL MODE and having to sift through all the garbage recommended creative maps made for toddlers.  I just wanna play zero build blitz homie

product_requests.description: An advanced AI agent specifically designed for debugging software. It would methodically analyze persistent bugs, try different approaches (e.g., console logs, temporary UI elements), identify root causes, explain them, and suggest fixes.
product_requests.pain_point: Developers spend significant time and effort on debugging, especially for complex or persistent issues. Existing tools may not be comprehensive or intelligent enough to pinpoint root causes efficiently.
product_requests.target_audience: Software Developers, QA Engineers, Technical Support

tweets.text:
here's my prompt to the agent builder for those curious:

I want to create a debug agent that is a beast at debugging even the most persistent, nasty bugs and issues. This debug agent is not afraid to go down into the weeds of things, trying different approaches, doing console logs, asking the user to open their localhost, resolving UI bugs by creating temporary UI elements, or checking console logs‚Äîanything that might be necessary to figure out the root cause of an issue and fix it.

This debug agent is so methodical; he just loves debugging like it's the love of his life. He's so methodical that if he encounters a persistent bug, he doesn't just want to try random things to fix it; he wants to get to the bottom of the bug. This is where he gets the joy of his life: he gets to the bottom of the bug, figures out the exact root cause behind it, explains that root cause, and then solves that root cause like it's a mathematical equation.

product_requests.description: A 'Tinder-like' platform for builders (developers, designers, etc.) where individuals can list their skills, set match thresholds, and swipe to connect with others based on complementary skill sets. The goal is to facilitate organic team formation and simplify hiring for early-stage projects.
product_requests.pain_point: Finding compatible cofounders or team members with specific technical skills is challenging and often relies on informal networks.
product_requests.target_audience: Startup Founders, Developers, Designers, Product Builders, Indie Hackers

tweets.text:
Weekend ideation:

There should be a Tinder for builders.
- People list their skills (TypeScript, Python,etc.)
- Set a match threshold (e.g. 70% overlap)
- Swipe to match with others based on skill sets.
and boom
Teams form organically
Even hiring would become easier. 

Thoughts?
@jia_seed happy to chat. we have a cofounder matching tool @colosseum with >1000 builders that might be helpful

product_requests.description: An AI-powered tool that can scrape websites and automatically structure the extracted data into a usable database format.
product_requests.pain_point: Manually collecting and structuring data from websites for database creation is time-consuming and requires technical expertise. Existing scraping tools may lack intelligent data structuring capabilities.
product_requests.target_audience: Data Analysts, Researchers, Small Business Owners, Developers building data-driven applications

tweets.text: we need an AI tool for creating database by scraping websites, if there already exists one please recommend

product_requests.description: A tool that automates the synchronization of professional profiles across various platforms like LinkedIn, CVs, and GitHub. It would simplify updating and maintaining a consistent professional narrative, potentially generating dynamic READMEs or portfolio pages.
product_requests.pain_point: Keeping multiple professional profiles (LinkedIn, CV, GitHub) updated and consistent is a 'pain' and 'impossible' manually, leading to outdated information and lost opportunities.
product_requests.target_audience: Developers, Job Seekers, Freelancers, Professionals in tech

tweets.text:
Let ºs be real: keeping your LinkedIn, CV, and GitHub in sync is impossible. 

üò© 

Manual READMEs are a pain. Templates are boring. And your real story gets lost. So I built a tool to fix all that‚Ä¶ 

Stay tuned! üöÄ #buildinpublic #SideProjects #buffer

product_requests.description: A job search tool that scrapes listings from various sources, provides robust filtering and saving options, and allows users to initiate applications only when they explicitly click, giving them control over the application process. It should focus on addressing the most painful parts of the job hunt.
product_requests.pain_point: Job seekers find the job hunt process painful, likely due to overwhelming listings, irrelevant results, and lack of control over automated applications.

tweets.text:
Would you use a job tool that scrapes listings, lets you filter/save, and only applies when you click? Let me know in the comment section

What‚Äôs the most painful part of your job hunt?
I‚Äôm building this with feedback first this time.

#buildinpublic #jobsearch #indiehackers
